trans-unit.source: Retrieves information about the active window or a specified GUI thread

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves information about the active window or a specified GUI thread

target.mrk: Retrieves information about the active window or a specified GUI thread

trans-unit.source: The identifier for the thread for which information is to be retrieved.

seg-source.mrk: The identifier for the thread for which information is to be retrieved.

target.mrk: The identifier for the thread for which information is to be retrieved.

trans-unit.source: The array that contains the following information:

seg-source.mrk: The array that contains the following information:

target.mrk: The array that contains the following information:

trans-unit.source: [0] - The thread state. It can be one or more of the $GUI_* values.

seg-source.mrk: It can be one or more of the $GUI_* values.

target.mrk: It can be one or more of the $GUI_* values.

trans-unit.source: [1] - A handle to the active window within the thread.

seg-source.mrk: [1] - A handle to the active window within the thread.

target.mrk: [1] - A handle to the active window within the thread.

trans-unit.source: [2] - A handle to the window that has the keyboard focus.

seg-source.mrk: [2] - A handle to the window that has the keyboard focus.

target.mrk: [2] - A handle to the window that has the keyboard focus.

trans-unit.source: [3] - A handle to the window that has captured the mouse.

seg-source.mrk: [3] - A handle to the window that has captured the mouse.

target.mrk: [3] - A handle to the window that has captured the mouse.

trans-unit.source: [4] - A handle to the window that owns any active menus.

seg-source.mrk: [4] - A handle to the window that owns any active menus.

target.mrk: [4] - A handle to the window that owns any active menus.

trans-unit.source: [5] - A handle to the window in a move or size loop.

seg-source.mrk: [5] - A handle to the window in a move or size loop.

target.mrk: [5] - A handle to the window in a move or size loop.

trans-unit.source: [6] - A handle to the window that is displaying the caret.

seg-source.mrk: [6] - A handle to the window that is displaying the caret.

target.mrk: [6] - A handle to the window that is displaying the caret.

trans-unit.source: [7] - The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the caret's bounding rectangle, in client coordinates.

seg-source.mrk: [7] - The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the caret's bounding rectangle, in client coordinates.

target.mrk: [7] - The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the caret's bounding rectangle, in client coordinates.

trans-unit.source: [8] - The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the caret's bounding rectangle, in client coordinates.

seg-source.mrk: [8] - The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the caret's bounding rectangle, in client coordinates.

target.mrk: [8] - The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the caret's bounding rectangle, in client coordinates.

trans-unit.source: [9] - The width of the caret's bounding rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: [9] - The width of the caret's bounding rectangle.

target.mrk: [9] - The width of the caret's bounding rectangle.

trans-unit.source: [10] - The height of the caret's bounding rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: [10] - The height of the caret's bounding rectangle.

target.mrk: [10] - The height of the caret's bounding rectangle.

trans-unit.source: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

seg-source.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

target.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.
